intro: Eremophila hughesii, commonly known as the Hughes' erymophila, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. This shrub typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its flowers are usually red or pink, attracting nectar-feeding birds and insects. The plant has small, narrow leaves and is often used in native gardens due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
